name: Christopher Bishop
background: British computer scientist (b. 1959), Microsoft Technical Fellow & Director Microsoft Research AI4Science. PhD theoretical physics (Edinburgh 1983, advisors Higgs/Wallace). Author seminal ML texts: Neural Networks for Pattern Recognition (1995), Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning (PRML 2006) - comprehensive Bayesian/probabilistic ML framework. FRS (2017), FREng, FRSE. Focus: pattern recognition, neural networks, graphical models.

principles.name: Graphical Models
principles.description: Bayesian networks/Markov Random Fields for modeling complex dependencies in structured data.
principles.falsification: When graphical models leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Mixture Density Networks
principles.description: Modeling multi-modal conditional distributions for complex outputs (e.g., regression with uncertainty).
principles.falsification: When mixture density networks leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Neural Networks for Pattern Recognition
principles.description: Flexible nonlinear modeling with principled Bayesian regularization (e.g., Gaussian processes as limits).
principles.falsification: When neural networks for pattern recognition leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Probabilistic Framework
principles.description: Bayesian inference as foundation for ML, explicit uncertainty modeling via priors/posteriors for robust predictions.
principles.falsification: When probabilistic framework leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
